players.name: Maya Rodriguez
players.wound: Parents' divorce shattered her sense of security
players.desire: To feel in control of her life again
players.arc: From trying to control everything to accepting uncertainty with grace

players.name: Derek Chen
players.wound: Constantly compared to his perfect older brother
players.desire: To be seen for who he is, not who he should be
players.arc: From living in a shadow to finding his own light

players.name: Grandma Rosa
players.wound: Outlived her husband and most of her friends
players.desire: To leave wisdom behind before it's too late
players.arc: From fearing irrelevance to embracing her role as keeper of stories

perspectives.name: Control vs Acceptance
perspectives.description: The struggle between trying to control life and accepting what we cannot change
perspectives.thematic_question: Can we find peace without control?

storybeats.title: The Announcement
storybeats.description: Maya's mom announces they're spending the summer at Grandma Rosa's. Maya tries to refuse but has no control.

storybeats.title: First Real Conversation
storybeats.description: Maya and Derek meet at the community center. Both are clearly there against their will. Their mutual resentment becomes unexpected connection.

moments.description: They both roll their eyes at the same moment

storybeats.title: Grandma's Story
storybeats.description: Rosa shares how she survived her husband's death - not by controlling her grief, but by letting herself feel it fully.

moments.description: Rosa shows Maya an old photo album

storybeats.title: Derek's Confession
storybeats.description: Derek reveals he's been accepted to art school but his parents want him to study medicine. Maya realizes control isn't always power.

storybeats.title: Letting Go
storybeats.description: Maya stops trying to get her parents back together. Instead, she accepts two homes, two lives, and finds freedom in that acceptance.

moments.description: Maya unpacks her bag at Grandma's

storybeats.title: Summer's End
storybeats.description: As summer ends, Maya, Derek, and Rosa sit together watching the sunset. Nothing is solved, but everything has changed.

moments.description: Three generations, three stories, one moment

storypoints.title: Forced Change
storypoints.description: Maya must spend summer away from her normal life

storypoints.title: Mirror Moment
storypoints.description: Maya sees her struggle reflected in Derek
